title: Target
description: Target describes the system, data, person, or physical property that was targeted by the insider. An incident may have many targets.

id.description: A unique string that begins with "target--" and is appended with a UUIDv4

category.description: The classification group a target belongs to

subcategory.description: The lower level classification group a target belongs to

format.description: The data type of the target

owner.description: Who the data is about. For assets, the owner of the asset. In cases where the owner and subject of the data or asset is unclear, pick the person or group most responsible for safeguarding the data or asset.

sensitivity.description: The level of sensitivity and controls applied to a target

oneOf.title: Facilities
oneOf.description: Buildings, offices, areas of buildings, or functions of buildings (such as disabling a door)

oneOf.title: Information
oneOf.description: Data or business materials that contain important details belonging to a specific target owner

oneOf.title: Money
oneOf.description: Currency, digital or physical, or materials, goods, or data that will be converted to currency or are currency equivalent

oneOf.title: People
oneOf.description: Employees, customers, individuals

oneOf.title: Technology
oneOf.description: Hardware, software, or firmware intended for the storage or transmission of data or the operation of equipment (as in computers running a manufacturing line)

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other asset type not listed in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Physical Property - Non-digital assets
oneOf.description: Physical property such as material goods or office furnishings

oneOf.title: Product Information
oneOf.description: Information about products or services the organization sells

oneOf.title: Business Plans
oneOf.description: Data or documents having to do with the everyday course of the business

oneOf.title: Government/Law Enforcement Information
oneOf.description: Classified or sensitive government or law enforcement information

oneOf.title: Money
oneOf.description: Currency, digital or physical, or materials, goods, or data that will be converted to currency or are currency equivalent

oneOf.title: Customer Data
oneOf.description: Information provided by customers or describing customers

oneOf.title: Employee Data
oneOf.description: Information collected from employees or describing employees

oneOf.title: Identification
oneOf.description: Digital or physical means of verifying identity

oneOf.title: Medical Information
oneOf.description: Information about an individuals' Protected Health Information (PHI) such as Medicare/Medicaid or prescription medications

oneOf.title: Person(s)
oneOf.description: Individual person or persons

oneOf.title: Network or Systems
oneOf.description: Platforms in which information is shared or processes are run

oneOf.title: Software
oneOf.description: Software or applications running on the organization's devices or systems

oneOf.title: Passwords
oneOf.description: Text strings which authenticate access to a system

oneOf.title: Communication Systems
oneOf.description: Servers, routers, phone systems, etc. that enable communication within the organization or between the organization and external entities

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: Unclear what was targeted

oneOf.title: Blueprint Plans
oneOf.description: Schematics for facility layout, products, or devices

oneOf.title: Facilities
oneOf.description: Buildings, offices, areas of buildings, or functions of buildings (such as disabling a door)

oneOf.title: Physical Products
oneOf.description: Tangible objects owned or managed by the organization

oneOf.title: Product Information
oneOf.description: Information about products or services offered by the organization

oneOf.title: Proprietary Information
oneOf.description: Information that gives the organization a competitive advantage, such as trade secrets, formulas, designs, or processes which could be exposed or sold to a competitor

oneOf.title: Business Plans
oneOf.description: Pitches or anything having to do with the everyday course of business

oneOf.title: Business System
oneOf.description: System which the organization requires to operate the business

oneOf.title: Commerce information
oneOf.description: Data related to the organization's business dealings, such as customer lists, pricing strategies, supplier contracts, or marketing plans

oneOf.title: Contract Information
oneOf.description: Information related to legal agreements made between the organization and other organizations or individuals such as employees or contractors

oneOf.title: Design and Plans
oneOf.description: Product design or information for a business plan

oneOf.title: Payroll Information
oneOf.description: Data relating to employee salaries, benefits, and tax information

oneOf.title: Classified Information
oneOf.description: Information that is restricted by the government for reasons of national security

oneOf.title: Sensitive Information
oneOf.description: Data that could cause harm to the organization or its stakeholders if leaked or misused

oneOf.title: Accounting Records
oneOf.description: Records tracking money, inventory, or purchases

oneOf.title: ATM Withdrawal
oneOf.description: Money that withdrawn from an ATM

oneOf.title: Bank Account Information
oneOf.description: Bank account information for a peculiar person or entity

oneOf.title: Bitcoin
oneOf.description: Money in the form of virtual currency

oneOf.title: Company Funds
oneOf.description: Monetary assets used for financing operations and initiatives of the organization

oneOf.title: Gift Cards
oneOf.description: Money in the form of prepaid debit cards for use at a specific vendor

oneOf.title: Invoices
oneOf.description: Money in the form of receiving funds from fraudulent invoices

oneOf.title: Issued Checks
oneOf.description: Money in the form of receiving funds from fraudulent checks

oneOf.title: Loan
oneOf.description: Money in the form of temporary funds given with the expectation of being repaid with interest

oneOf.title: Physical Currency
oneOf.description: Money in the form of tangible paper bills, coins, or other means of circulation that holds direct monetary value

oneOf.title: Refunds
oneOf.description: Money in the form of reimbursements for returend goods or services

oneOf.title: Reimbursement Forms
oneOf.description: Information related to reports of incurred transaction expenses

oneOf.title: Tax Information
oneOf.description: Tax forms, documentation, or identifiers

oneOf.title: Time Sheets
oneOf.description: Digital or analog forms for employees to report hours worked

oneOf.title: Client List
oneOf.description: Listing of organizations or individuals which are provided services by the organization

oneOf.title: Customer Data
oneOf.description: Information about customers or provided by customers

oneOf.title: Immigration Records
oneOf.description: Records of individuals who are unaturalized immigrants

oneOf.title: Credit Card Information
oneOf.description: Information relating to a credit card such as the card number, the cardholder's name, when the card expires, and the card's security code

oneOf.title: Insurance Claims
oneOf.description: Information relating to monetary claims made in request to an insurance policy

oneOf.title: Employee Data
oneOf.description: Information about employees or belonging to employees of an organization

oneOf.title: Driver's license
oneOf.description: Information related to a legal identification that provides a permit to operate a motor vehicle

oneOf.title: Personal Photos
oneOf.description: Images of a personal nature or unrelated to the organization's business

oneOf.title: PII
oneOf.description: Sensitive information that can be used to identify an individual

oneOf.title: PHI
oneOf.description: Sensitive information that is indicative of an individual's health condition

oneOf.title: Medicare/Medicaid
oneOf.description: Information related to health insurance provided by the state to the elderly or financially limited populations

oneOf.title: Prescription Medication
oneOf.description: Iinformation that relates to doctors notes permiting the purchase of controlled medical substances

oneOf.title: Prescription Pads
oneOf.description: Secured stationery notes that doctors use for writing prescriptions

oneOf.title: Self
oneOf.description: The insider is targeting themself

oneOf.title: Others
oneOf.description: Indivdual or individuals other than the insider

oneOf.title: Backup Data
oneOf.description: Data that can be used to restore a system or dataset if it becomes compromised

oneOf.title: Backup Tapes
oneOf.description: Stored backup data copied to a tape cartridge

oneOf.title: Database
oneOf.description: Structured electronic digital information repository

oneOf.title: Email Servers
oneOf.description: Systems used to host and deliver email services

oneOf.title: FTP Servers
oneOf.description: Systems which allow the exchange of files between two or more computers

oneOf.title: Network Configuration
oneOf.description: Routing or network access configuration

oneOf.title: Network Login Information
oneOf.description: Information related to access credentials for a network

oneOf.title: Servers
oneOf.description: System(s) which host information or digital services for end users

oneOf.title: Website Hosting
oneOf.description: System(s) for delivering websites over the internet

oneOf.title: Backup Software
oneOf.description: Software designed to create copies of data for safe storage

oneOf.title: Software Policy Protocol
oneOf.description: Rules developed by an organization for the ideal deployment of a software

oneOf.title: Source code
oneOf.description: Underlying codebase for a product or system

oneOf.title: Unreleased Software
oneOf.description: Software that has not yet been made available

oneOf.title: Login Information
oneOf.description: Credentials used for access to a technological system

oneOf.title: Passwords
oneOf.description: Access credentials in the form of a text string

oneOf.title: Emails
oneOf.description: Electronic communications in the form of static messages shared to specified user addresses via a network

oneOf.title: Telecommunication Systems
oneOf.description: Networks that facilitate digital or voice communications

oneOf.title: Electronic
oneOf.description: Technological digital format

oneOf.title: Physical
oneOf.description: Tangible real-world format

oneOf.title: Personnel
oneOf.description: People or individuals

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other format not listed in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Unknown
oneOf.description: Unclear what was targeted

oneOf.title: Consumer
oneOf.description: An individual that purchases and makes use of a product or service

oneOf.title: Employee
oneOf.description: An individual internal to an organization who facilitates the disbursement of products or services

oneOf.title: Organization
oneOf.description: The organization, rather than its employees or customers, owns the target

oneOf.title: Third Party
oneOf.description: Parties external to an organization and consumers

oneOf.title: Other
oneOf.description: Other owner not listed in this vocabulary

oneOf.title: Unclassified
oneOf.description: No classification

oneOf.title: Confidential
oneOf.description: Public disclosure would damage national security

oneOf.title: FOUO
oneOf.description: For official use only

oneOf.title: Secret
oneOf.description: Public disclosure would cause serious damage to national security

oneOf.title: SecretNoForn
oneOf.description: Secret / restricted to country of source

oneOf.title: Top Secret (TS)
oneOf.description: Top secret - unauthorized disclosure would cause exceptionally grave damage to national security

oneOf.title: TS/SCI
oneOf.description: Top secret / Sensitive compartmented information

oneOf.title: NATORestricted
oneOf.description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization Restricted

oneOf.title: NATOConfidential
oneOf.description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization Confidential

oneOf.title: NATOSecret
oneOf.description: North Atlantic Treaty Organization Secret

oneOf.title: CosmicTopSecret
oneOf.description: Top Secret documents managed by a COSMIC registry

oneOf.title: FVEYProprietary
oneOf.description: Five eyes proprietary

oneOf.title: Proprietary
oneOf.description: Information a company wishes to keep confidential (e.g. trade secrets)

oneOf.title: Personal identifiable information (PII)
oneOf.description: Information which can be used to distinguish or trace an individual's identity, such as their name, social security number, biometric records, etc. alone, or when combined with other personal or identifying information which is linked or linkable to a specific individual, such as date and place of birth, mother's maiden name, etc.

oneOf.title: HIPPA/Protected Health Information (PHI)
oneOf.description: Individually identifiable health information, held or maintained by a covered entity or its business associates acting for the covered entity, that is transmitted or maintained in any form or medium. This includes identifiable demographic and other information relating to the past, present, or future physical or mental health or condition of an individual, or the provision or payment of health care to an individual that is created or received by a health care provider, health plan, employer, or health care clearinghouse.

oneOf.title: GDPR
oneOf.description: General data protection regulation

oneOf.title: Public
oneOf.description: Unrestricted/open to the public

oneOf.title: CUI
oneOf.description: Controlled Unclassified Information

oneOf.title: Controlled Technical Information (CTI)
oneOf.description: Technical information subject to controls to access, use, reproduction, or dissemination

oneOf.title: FERPA (student education records)
oneOf.description: Information subject to sensitity due to relevance to student educational privacy

oneOf.title: Federal Tax Information (FTI)
oneOf.description: Information that subject to sensitivty that is derived from tax returns

oneOf.title: Government Sensitive
oneOf.description: Classified or sensitive information used by and only available to the government

oneOf.title: Intellectual Property (IP)
oneOf.description: Information that has been created and is subject to protection of its creativity

oneOf.title: Law Enforcement Sensitive
oneOf.description: Information, software, or device used by and only available to law enforcement

oneOf.title: Non-Public
oneOf.description: Information not made available to the public

oneOf.title: Credit/Payment Card (PCI)
oneOf.description: Credit/payment card information
